Title: Software Development Engineer II (Government)
JD:
About the job
    


          AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Intelligence Community. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing, and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers’ mission.

AT&T is a prime contractor on the SITE III IDIQ program for the Department of Defense. AT&T won the SITE III IDIQ in 2021 and anticipates award of a large enterprise IT WAN Task Order in 1st quarter FY 2023. For the Chief Information Office (CIO), the Task Order provides IT managed services for a Government TS/SCI network modernization program focused on specific technologies and hardware needed to operate the wide area network, or highway, that enables TS/SCI communications.

AT&T has an opening for a Software Development Engineer to create, maintain, and perform operations and maintenance (O&M) on collection capabilities and deliverables to adapt to changes in collection target, technologies, data formats, and naming conventions within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment

Duties/Responsibilities:
As a Software Developer, you will work with the development team and assist with designing, deploying, and maintaining multiple, fast-turnaround capabilities utilized to perform highly visible and high-priority collection efforts and ensure all capabilities and deliverables meet defined requirements and tradecraft needsAs a Software Developer, you will create, maintain, and perform operations and maintenance (O&M) on collection capabilities and deliverables to adapt to changes in collection target, technologies, data formats, and naming conventions within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environmentDesign and document software components that meet organization and industry standardsCode high quality software components in accordance with organizational standards, technical requirements, and detailed designsEffectively participate in a team-oriented environment that involves continuous design reviews, code reviews, and collaborationProactively communicate with Development Manager and/or Technical Lead regarding the status and potential impacts on the delivery date and/or expected quality of tasks and projectsActively work with Project Management and QA teams and produce technical documentation required by QA

Required Clearance:

TS/SCI with poly (#ts/sci) (#polygraph)

Required Qualifications:

Candidate must have a total of 8 years of applicable experience. The experience can be a combination of degree and work history. This can be a High School degree and 8 years of work history OR an Associate’s and 6 years, a Bachelors’ and 4 years, a master’s and 2 years or a PhD and 2 years of relevant work history.

Ready to join our team? Apply today!

JobCategory:Technology

For the Chief Information Office (CIO), the Task Order provides IT managed services for a Government TS/SCI network modernization program focused on specific technologies and hardware needed to operate the wide area network, or highway, that enables TS/SCI communications.

AT&T has an opening for a Software Development Engineer to create, maintain, and perform operations and maintenance (O&M) on collection capabilities and deliverables to adapt to changes in collection target, technologies, data formats, and naming conventions within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment.

As a Software Developer, you will work with the development team and assist with designing, deploying, and maintaining multiple, fast-turnaround capabilities utilized to perform highly visible and high-priority collection efforts and ensure all capabilities and deliverables meet defined requirements and tradecraft needsAs a Software Developer, you will create, maintain, and perform operations and maintenance (O&M) on collection capabilities and deliverables to adapt to changes in collection target, technologies, data formats, and naming conventions within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environmentDesign and document software components that meet organization and industry standardsCode high quality software components in accordance with organizational standards, technical requirements, and detailed designsEffectively participate in a team-oriented environment that involves continuous design reviews, code reviews, and collaborationProactively communicate with Development Manager and/or Technical Lead regarding the status and potential impacts on the delivery date and/or expected quality of tasks and projectsActively work with Project Management and QA teams and produce technical documentation required by QA
